result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Courtney Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay al mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To make regular monthly payments.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment, unless he has a certified disability.
Complete a mental health evaluation. Comply with any recommended treatment.

No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No firearms.
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.
AODA assessment.  Comply with all recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random drug tests, to be tested once per month.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing JANUARY 30, 2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF2636 (53 Pages).  KD

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Dana L. Gimbel.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Private PSI reviewed. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Gregory C.-T.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 38 MONTHS, CONCURRENT with any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- AODA assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant to be tested once per month.
- No firearms.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, unless he has a certified disability.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.

  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Dana L. Gimbel.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Case tagging along with defendant's pending case.  Case will be set for sentencing at next court date.  Case adjourned for status on 10/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to make all contacts with Justice Point.  aw  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Stephen Sargent and attorney Dana L. Gimbel.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Attorney Gimble has informed the court that she has been retained.  Court allows attorney Sargent to withdraw.  All discovery was turned over to attorney Gimble.  Case adjourned for status on 10/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/18/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Dennis Murphy, appearing for Kevin R. Shomin, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Jason Rodriguez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Randall Courtney Brown in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
